SENT.plain: We present the MRI findings in five patients with congenital muscular dystrophy (CMD) and merosin (laminin alpha2) deficiency, which was total in one and partial in four
In one patient with partial merosin deficiency, MRI was normal
The other four patients had supratentorial white matter abnormalities
In three, T2-weighted images revealed subcortical, deep lobar and periventricular high signal in white matter, while in the other there were only small peritrigonal areas of increased signal
On T1-weighted images, there was slightly low signal
None of these changes were accompanied by symptoms or signs of central nervous system involvement
White matter abnormalities in a patient with CMD should prompt investigation of merosin
